p: Non-communicable diseases are on the rise causing 71% of deaths globally [ 8]. Such alarming situation has prompted the need to develop new drugs to improve quality of life and decrease preventable deaths. Alzheimerâ€™s disease (AD) is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder with low acetylcholine level in the brain of patients. To date, scientists have failed to find a cure for AD due to the lack of understanding on the causes and mechanisms of the disease [ 9]. As a therapeutic strategy, cholinesterase inhibitors as donepezil, rivastigmine and galantamine are prescribed to patients to help postponing the symptoms of AD, but they present significant side effects [ 10, 11].
